answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some resources that you may find useful while making decisions about your own wellness program.
This link goes to the Infinite Wellness Solution group which compiled a list of online resources on how to implement low or no cost wellness plans.
http://www.infinitewellnesssolutions.com/free_wellness.htm
Another website call The Wellness Advantage has information on wellness programs that pay for themselves.
http://www.yourwellnessadvantage.com/article/putting_together_a_wellness_program_that_pays_for_itself/
The site My Heath LA has a list of tips and suggestions for low budget employee wellness programs.
http://myhealthla.org/2010/11/low-budget-employee-wellness-programs-a-good-start/
A similar list can be found below from Ceridian, a human resources, payroll, benefits and payment solutions organization.
http://www.ceridian.com/eap_article/1,6266,15757-71171,00.html
I have also included an article about San Mateo County, CA which was recognized by the state for being one of the healthiest offices.
http://icma.org/en/Article/11706/San_Mateo_County_California_Recognized_as_Healthy_Employer
I hope these help!
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Gaylene Rhoden
text: We have 15 FTE (along with several seasonal, paid-on-call FF). Are there any suggestions for a wellness program for a small organization with minimal cost or no cost?
title: Wellness Programs for Small Communities
